description.narrative:
Strengthening Participatory Organization-SPO The Strategic Partnership project will contribute to ensuring that women have a say inlocal water related peace building processes and policies and their say in considered in water related aspects in Sindh Province byadopting the issues/disputes resolution strategy to influence policy change and empowerment of people and CSOs to claim their rights and involved in peace building process of water disputes. The project will target areas of Akram Wah Division, including the District Hyderabad, Badin and Tando Muhammad Khan of Sindh province. The Strengthening Participatory Organization: SPO Pakistan is implementing the project in one district of Sindh i.e. Hyderabad.
The project will contribute in followingOxfam corporate outcome areas Outcomes and outputs Nr.3200) Improved policies Governments and Global actors: a. 01 case where Oxfam and # of partners influencinghas contributed to (sub) national governments/ global actors addressing root causes of conflict b. 04 case studies, 01 (Project) video documentary, and 01 policy brief as pieces of evidence produced by Oxfam or partners in support of development/adoption of alternative policies/approaches c. 04 case studies, 01 video documentary, and 01policy brief as pieces of evidence produced by Oxfamor partners to support monitoring of practices and implementation of policies by governments and global actors
Nr. 3120) Strengthened CSOs a. 01 CSOs increasingly participate in or initiate influencing and advocacy efforts to contribute to conflict transformation, /address root causes of conflict; b. 01 Organisations supported with means (financial, knowledge, skills, networks, training etc.) to strengthen capacity in specific areas. c. 01 of networks provided with secretariat support (i.e. stationary, meeting space etc)
Nr. 3240) Increased citizens' voice a. 37 of women take action to contribute to conflict transformation/address root causes of conflict following Oxfam /partners# actions b. 86 men take action to contribute to conflict transformation/address root causes of conflict following Oxfam /partners# actions c. 03 people (men and women) take action to contribute to conflict transformation/address root causes of conflict followingOxfam /partners# actions. d. 120 women and men participating in public events / spaces organised by Oxfam or partners e. 259 of public events/spaces organised by Oxfam or partners in which citizens express their needs and aspirations to policy makers. f.# media citations of Oxfam or partners# research or products
Nr. 3250) Stronger and wider alliances
a. 02 cases in which Oxfam, partners have strengthened and/or broadened alliances in order to contribute to conflict transformation/address rootcauses of conflict. b. 02 cases in which Oxfam or partners supported joint agendas of networks and alliances. c. 20 stakeholder sessions organised by Oxfam or partners. d. 424 (men <(>&<)> women) participants in stakeholder sessions organised by Oxfam or partners.
Nr. 3130) Increased political will
a. # of cases of influential endorsing gender sensitive policies asks of Oxfam/ partner towards conflict transformation b. 01 of alternative policies/approaches presented by Oxfam, or international personsorinstitutions c. 02 campaigns in which Oxfam, or partners participated
Nr. 3170) Shifted norms and attitudes a. 36 Women, including people living in poverty and injustice, consider inclusion in water governance and related peacebuilding and policyprocesses fundamental right for women and men. b. 84 Men, including people living in poverty and injustice, consider inclusion in water governance and related peacebuilding and policy processes fundamental right for women and men. c. 05 of role models / frontrunners expressing their views during events or on platforms organised by Oxfam, or partners
Under the outcome 1, contribute towards the Conflict <(>&<)> Fragility programme document towards worldwide influencing Pathway 1: Civil society empowermentand engagement; by building the capacities of women's leaders' to have increased confidence and ability to claim their rights with regards to water management as well as to play more meaningful roles in both formal and informal peacebuilding processes around water. Under the outcome 2; An Advisory Committee (AC) will be established under this project to prove guidance to the network members and helping them establish linkages with like-mindedorganizations, groups and stakeholders. The Outcome 3 also contributesto Pathway 4: Engagement with government authorities and informal leaders, engaging with both formal and informal governance.

participating-org.narrative: SPO is a new partner organisation to Oxfam Novib, though it has worked with Oxfam GB and Oxfam Canada before. Established in 1994, SPO is now one of the larger Pakistani national NGOs, working in 69 districts through 17 offices. SPO#s core competency is communitymobilisation (so far it has enabled about 1,450 CBOs), capacity building of CBOs and development of institutions for basic social services, including primary health, education, water and sanitation. CBO members volunteer for SPO. SPO is a rights-based organisation and as such is also actively involved in advocacy, research, awareness raising activities and policy dialogues. All of SPO#s activities promote gender equality and women#s empowerment.
